instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid spilled, after cleaning 20V 0.53A but not turning on, T2 warming up
threads.message:
Tried to push to DFU multiple times and not engaging. I can see how the current drops to 0 and back to 0,53 when doing DFu but won't be seen by other device ( via T3 cable which is tested and works. )

Melted connector on the audio board, but same with or without it. 
[ATTACH type="full"]61168[/ATTACH]


Any suggestions?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid spilled, after cleaning 20V 0.53A but not turning on, T2 warming up
threads.message:
Audio connector has T2 lines placed too close to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Check J6100 pins in diode mode; compare with good board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid spilled, after cleaning 20V 0.53A but not turning on, T2 warming up
threads.message: All in 0.4-0.7 range apart than side grounds, matching a good board

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid spilled, after cleaning 20V 0.53A but not turning on, T2 warming up
threads.message:
If connector has been melt in such manner, something connected there is now damaged.

Do you get all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages?
